column3: judging from the impression of the seal and the lid
column4: he thought there must be something precious inside. To find out
column6: and with a little trouble he opened it. He turned it upside down
column8: which surprised him very much. He set it in front of him
column9: and whilst he was looking at it attentively
column10: such a thick smoke came out that he had to step back a pace or two. This smoke rose up to the clouds
column11: and stretching over the sea and the shore
column13: which caused the fisherman much astonishment. When all the smoke was out of the jar it gathered itself together
column14: and became a thick mass in which appeared a genius
column15: twice as large as the largest giant. When he saw such a terrible-looking monster
column16: the fisherman would like to have run away
column17: but he trembled so with fright that he could not move a step.
